title: Add Temperature API
body: Please add an API that allows to read the temperature from the device (e.g. mobile phone CPU temperature).

comments.body: Sorry, I've posted the wrong link: https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/windowsapps/en-US/07642953-17f8-44a5-bceb-bafaf61b3ea7/uwpcustom-sensor-device-raises-exception?forum=wpdevelop

BTW: Temperature information is already available through WMI or C classes. However, for mobile devices, there is no such API available. Or maybe, the Custom Sensor API contains a bug as it raises an exception: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.devices.power.batteryreport

I mean, first, it's just an information. Then, second, this information can be used for different purposes depending on the device. E.g. as simple thermometer on mobile devices. The current BatteryReport class already contains information e.g. about the capacity or charge rate. Maybe, this is not so interesting for non-mobile but for mobile devices. So, why shouldn't there also be information about the temperature?

Issue here is the "why" and the scenario around the need for the API.  Also what about all the other devices that may act differently.  At a platform level, how would this work for a Surface Hub versus a desktop vs a laptop vs a HoloLens vs an Xbox?

Maybe, just to get the temperature for a simple thermometer app, the battery temperature could be added to the BatteryReport class: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.devices.power.batteryreport
This is the way they have done it on Android and shouldn't be a big deal. What do you think about this implementation, Clint?

Yes exactly. I'd like to get the temperatures from the different thermal zone. E.g. on my Lumia 650, ther is the following Qualcomm device: \\?\ACPI#QCOM24AE#0#{4afa3d51-74a7-11d0-be5e-00a0c9062857"}. However, using the custom sensor API doesn't work. I've described the issue here: https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/windowsapps/en-US/07642953-17f8-44a5-bceb-bafaf61b3ea7/uwpcustom-sensor-device-raises-exception?forum=wpdevelop
That sounds like an OS feature request, how would you as a developer use this.

The API could provide temperature information from the different thermal zones of the mobile phone. This information could be used by apps in form of a simple  thermometer. It could also indicate if a phone is potentially overheating and could provide alerts to the user.
